metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3981 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: A flaw in grub2 was found where its configuration file, known as grub.cfg,is being created with the wrong permission set allowing non privilegedusers to read its content. This represents a low severity confidentialityissue, as those users can eventually read any encrypted passwords presentin grub.cfg. This flaw affects grub2 2.06 and previous versions. This issuehas been fixed in grub upstream but no version with the fix is currentlyreleased.

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-unsigned: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
